DOC.brief_summary: - Prospective , multi-center , single-arm registry study - A total 100 subject isolated popliteal artery lesion accord inclusion exclusion criterion enrol . - All popliteal artery lesion treat drug-eluting balloon ( In.PACT Admiral , Medtronic ) . • Atherectomy use bare nitinol stent combination drug-eluting balloon allow • Patients follow clinically 12 month procedure . - Imaging study ( Duplex ultrasound , CT angiography catheter angiography ) follow-up perform 12 month .
DOC.brief_title: Korean Multicenter Prospective Registry In.PACT DEB Isolated Popliteal Artery Disease ( K-POP Study )
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age 19 year old 2 . Symptomatic peripheral artery disease : Moderate severe claudication ( Rutherford category 2 3 ) Critical limb ischemia ( Rutherford category 4 5 ) 3 . Atherosclerotic popliteal artery disease ( stenosis > 50 % ) 4 . Patients sign informed consent 1 . Acute critical limb ischemia 2 . Severe critical limb ischemia ( Rutherford category 6 ) 3 . Involvement SFA disease stenosis 4 . Continous total occlusion proximal infrapopliteal artery ( origin anterior tibial artery tibioperoneal trunk ) . 5 . Known hypersensitivity contraindication follow medication : heparin , aspirin , clopidogrel , contrast agent 6 . Age > 85 year 7 . Severe hepatic dysfunction ( > 3 time normal reference value ) 8 . Significant leucopenia , neutropenia , thrombocytopenia , anemia , know bleed diathesis 9 . LVEF < 40 % clinically overt congestive heart failure 10 . Pregnant woman woman potential childbearing 11 . Life expectancy < 1 year due comorbidity 12 . Previous bypass surgery stenting target popliteal artery 13 . Untreated inflow disease ipsilateral pelvic femoropopliteal artery ( 50 % stenosis occlusion )
DOC.keyword: Popliteal artery disease , drug-eluting balloon , angioplasty
